amendment.description: At the end of the bill (before the short title), insert the following: \ LIMITATION ON ECONOMIC SUPPORT FUND ASSISTANCE FOR CERTAIN FOREIGN GOVERNMENTS THAT ARE PARTIES TO THE INTERNATIONAL CRIMINAL COURT \ SEC.__. None of the funds made available in this Act in title II under the heading "ECONOMIC SUPPORT FUND" may be used to provide assistance to the government of a country that is a party to the International Criminal Court and has not entered into an agreement with the United States pursuant to Article 98 of the Rome Statute preventing the International Criminal Court from proceeding against United States personnel present in such country.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 6 printed in the Congressional Record to prohibit ESF assistance to the government of any country that is a party to the International Criminal Court and has not signed an Article 98 agreement to to surrender U.S. nationals to the ICC.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Nethercutt amendment (A015) Agreed to by recorded vote: 241 - 166 (Roll no. 387).

action.text: House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A015) offered by Mr. Nethercutt.
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Nethercutt amendment (A015) Agreed to by recorded vote: 241 - 166 (Roll no. 387).
